events.title: International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds
events.description: Report covering 23 conflicts over last 18 months concludes more than 100,000 civilians have been killed as war crimes rage out of control An authoritative survey of 23 armed conflicts over the last 18 months has concluded that international law seeking to limit the effects of war is at breaking point, with more than 100,000 civilians killed, while torture and rape are committed with near impunity. The extensive study by the Geneva Academy of International Humanitarian Law and Human Rights describes the deaths of 18,592 children in Gaza, growing civilian casualties in Ukraine and an ‚Äúepidemic‚Äù of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds

events.title: Islamic State claims attack on international airport and airbase in Niger
events.description: Motorcycle-riding militants launch strikes using heavy weaponry and drones, damaging planes belonging to Ivorian carrier and Togolese airline Islamic State in the Sahel has claimed responsibility for an audacious assault at the international airport and adjacent air force base in Niamey, the capital of Niger, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which tracks jihadist activity and communications worldwide. The attack, which began shortly after midnight on Thursday, reportedly involved motorcycle-riding militants who launched a ‚Äúsurprise and coordinated‚Äù strike using heavy weaponry and drones, according to statements released via IS in the Sahel‚Äôs propaganda arm, Amaq news agency. events.title: ‚ÄòPure apocalypse‚Äô: a photographer‚Äôs journey through the Pantanal wildfires
events.description: Ahead of a major exhibition in London documenting the South American wetland as it faces unprecedented threat, Lalo de Almeida recounts the stories behind his award-winning images Lalo de Almeida is a documentary photographer based in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. In 2021 his photo essay Pantanal Ablaze was awarded first place in the environment stories category at the World Press Photo contest. In 2022, he won the Eugene Smith grant in humanistic photography and World Press Photo‚Äôs long-term project award for his work Amazonian Dystopia , which documents the exploitation of the world‚Äôs largest tropical forest. I have been photographing socio-environmental issues for more than 30 years, especially in the Amazon. 2020 was no different. News of the uncontrolled fires devastating the Pantanal began to catch my attention. So, together with a fellow journalist, I decided to go and see what was happening for myself. Continue reading...

events.title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in eastern DRC, officials say
events.description: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the world‚Äôs coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phones More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday. Rubaya produces about 15% of the world‚Äôs coltan, which is processed into tantalum ‚Äì a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

About 150 people were due to leave the territory on Monday, and 50 to enter it, according to Egyptian officials, more than 20 months after Israeli forces closed the crossing. events.title: Images show abandoned belongings and mock police stations at a former scam center in Asia
events.description: In the town of O‚ÄôSmach, along Cambodia‚Äôs northern border with Thailand, stands a compound of abandoned buildings that were battered by shelling during recent weeks of armed clashes. The site, now occupied by Thai troops, had served as one of Cambodia‚Äôs notorious scam centers, according to Thai officials. A six-story building, shown to journalists and international observers on Monday during a trip organized by the Thai military, is scattered with documents, equipment and personal belongings, likely abandoned in haste. ‚ÄúThey are well-organized. They have good infrastructure and systems, and also the workflow and many, many tactics and techniques to do the scams,‚Äù said Lt. Gen. Teeranan Nandhakwang, director of the Thai army‚Äôs intelligence unit. Experts say such scam operations in Cambodia and elsewhere have cheated people around the world out of billions of dollars and tricked people from many countries to work in them under slave-like conditions. The Thai military said the...
events.ticker_label: ü™ñ Images show abandoned belongings and mock police stations at a former scam center in Asia

events.title: Living hell of North Korea‚Äôs ‚Äòparadise on Earth‚Äô scheme back in spotlight in Japan
events.description: Plaintiffs in case say they were lured from Japan, exploited for labour and cut off from families for generations It has been more than six decades since Eiko Kawasaki left Japan to begin a new life in North Korea . Then 17, she was among tens of thousands of people with Korean heritage who had been lured to the communist state by the promise of a ‚Äúparadise on Earth‚Äù. Instead, they encountered something closer to a living hell. They were denied basic human rights and forced to endure extreme hardship. Official promises of free education and healthcare plus guaranteed jobs and housing had been a cruel mirage. And to their horror, they were prevented from travelling to Japan to visit the families they had left behind. Continue reading...

events.description: President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housing.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.description: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Germany news: 13 million living at risk of poverty
events.description: The share of people living at risk of poverty has increased to 16%, up a percentage point from the year earlier. Meanwhile, authorities have questioned the moderate stance of the AfD's new youth wing. DW has the latest.

events.title: Norway: Son of crown princess on trial over rape charges
events.description: Marius Borg Hoiby, the son of Norwegian Crown Princess Mette-Marit, denies four counts of rape but faces over 30 other charges just days after his mother was named several hundred times in the Epstein files.

events.title: Venezuela: Interim President Delcy Rodriguez meets US envoy
events.description: Venezuela and the US open talks on energy, trade and political transition after years of frozen relations.

events.title: France's 2026 budget finally gets passed
events.description: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu's minority government made it through two no-confidence votes before finally getting his 2026 budget over the line.

events.title: Russian captain found guilty in North Sea tanker collision
events.description: Vladimir Motin has been convicted for manslaughter after a deadly collision last year off the coast of the UK.

events.title: Trump announces India 'trade deal' after Modi call
events.description: After speaking with India's PM, Trump said that the US would lower its tariff rate on Indian goods, while again claiming that India had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Modi thanked Trump for the deal.

events.title: Syrian army enters Kurdish-held al-Hassakeh after deal
events.description: An agreement to transition control from Kurdish to government forces is now underway. It brings the end to weeks of fighting as well as the Kurds' years-long de facto autonomy.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.description: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: The Bright Side: 13-year-old boy swims four hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: Teenager Austin Appelbee swam four hours through the ocean to find help for his mother and two siblings after they were swept out to sea while kayaking.

events.title: League Cup: Arsenal host Chelsea in semi-final second leg
events.description: Arsenal host Chelsea in the League Cup semi-final second leg. The Gunners won 3-2 in the first leg last month. They have lost only one of their last 14 matches.

events.title: Washington presses Venezuela interim leader on post-Maduro 'transition'

events.title: French investigators raid Paris offices of Elon Musk's X

events.title: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years - sparking more controversy over DC venue
events.description: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.

events.description: Michelangelo‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Last Judgment‚Äù is undergoing its first major restoration in three decades

events.title: Trevi Fountain fee goes into effect as Rome seeks to manage tourist flow
events.description: Tourists visiting Rome's Trevi Fountain now pay a $2.35 fee for close access

events.title: Police say the Norwegian crown princess‚Äô son has been arrested just before his trial on rape and other charges opens
events.description: Police say the Norwegian crown princess‚Äô son has been arrested just before his trial on rape and other charges opens

events.title: Germany detains 5 men accused of illegally exporting goods to Russia
events.description: German authorities have detained five men accused of being part of a network that illegally exported goods to Russian defense companies after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine

events.title: UN peacekeeping patrols suspended along Lebanon-Israel Blue Line
events.description: UN peacekeepers temporarily suspended patrols and other activities along parts of the ‚ÄòBlue Line‚Äô in southern Lebanon after the Israeli military said it would release what it described as a non-toxic chemical substance near the frontier, the UN said on Monday.

events.title: Gaza: Limited Rafah crossing reopening sparks hope ‚Äì but also ‚Äòmassive trepidation‚Äô
events.description: The reopening of the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday after more than a year is being met with both optimism and fear, a senior official with the UN agency that assists the Palestinian people, UNRWA, has said.

events.title: Invisible highways: The vast network of undersea cables powering our connectivity
events.description: Every day, we send countless emails, take part in video calls, use search engines and streaming services, while seamlessly banking online.

events.title: Savannah Guthrie's mother Nancy possibly abducted from her home, authorities say
events.description: Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother Nancy was possibly kidnapped from her Arizona home. The sheriff confirmed a crime scene was found, and believes she was taken against her will.

events.title: Virginia man Brendan Banfield learns fate in twisted au pair affair double-murder
events.description: Brendan Banfield, former IRS officer, was found guilty of orchestrating a murder plot with the family's au pair to kill his wife Christina and frame Joseph Ryan.

events.title: Good Samaritan hijacks crooks‚Äô getaway car and rams it into jewelry store during smash-and-grab: police
events.description: Bystander allegedly rams getaway car into Petaluma jewelry store during armed robbery, forcing suspects to flee on foot after dramatic intervention.

events.title: WATCH: Surgeon accused of killing ex-wife and her dentist husband appears unfazed during jail booking
events.description: Jail video shows surgeon accused of murdering ex-wife and her dentist husband calmly entering custody after extradition from Illinois to Ohio.

events.title: Minneapolis teachers union chief admits elected officials in anti-ICE Signal chats

events.title: Groundhog Day: Punxsutawney Phil makes 140th weather prediction
